TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DiscreteRotation3DKeyFrame extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DKeyFrame

Docs.summary: Animates from the value of the previous key frame to its own <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DKeyFrame.Value%2A> using discrete interpolation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is used as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DKeyFrameCollection> in conjunction with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DAnimationUsingKeyFrames> object to animate a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rotation3D> property value along a set of key frames.
A key frame defines a segment of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DAnimationUsingKeyFrames> to which it belongs. Each key frame has a target <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DKeyFrame.Value%2A> and a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DKeyFrame.KeyTime%2A>. The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DKeyFrame.KeyTime%2A> specifies the time at which the key frame's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Rotation3DKeyFrame.Value%2A> should be reached. A key frame animates from the target value of the previous key frame to its own target value. It starts when the previous key frame ends and ends when its own key time is reached.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rotation3D value, valuetype System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime keyTime) cil managed

Docs.param: The ending value (also known as "target value") for the key frame.
The key time for the key frame. The key time determines when the target value is reached, which is also when the key frame ends.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified ending value and key time.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rotation3D InterpolateValueCore (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rotation3D baseValue, double keyFrameProgress);

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rotation3D InterpolateValueCore(class System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rotation3D baseValue, float64 keyFrameProgress) cil managed

Docs.param: A value from 0.0 through 1.0 that specifies the percentage of time that has elapsed for this key frame.
Docs.summary: Computes a discrete interpolation between the previous key frame value and the value of the current key frame, using the supplied progress increment.
Docs.returns: The output value of this key frame given the specified base value and progress.
